humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor classification is pTlc (m), pN2a (7/25), MX, R0, G2 (L0, V0). This means that the patient has 7 positive lymph nodes out of 25 assessed lymph nodes. According to Rule 13, N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pN' category in the TNM staging system refers to the spread of cancer to nearby lymph nodes.\nIn this report, the patient has a 'pN2a (7/25)' classification, which indicates that 7 out of 25 examined lymph nodes contained cancerous cells.\nTherefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.
